Reviews.Title: “Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, the room we had was a triple, though we had booked a double, it was 60 euros. Very good value at that price. It is near to Museumplein and concertgebouw. The room was lovely, clean, comfy beds, quiet, nice view, warm, nothing could have been better. The breakfast was tasty, but chaotic. They need to have more staff on duty as 2 was not enough to cope. The 2 staff were busy making hot rolls and cooked egg and bacon. This meant they didn't have time to replenish the breakfast buffet area. At one point there was nothing out, no coffee, orange juice, bread or cheese. When an item appeared (by request) it was soon snapped up by hungry breakfasters. The staff also didn't have time to clear tables when people had finished so new people coming down had to sit in the remains of someone else's meal. I felt sorry for the staff, trying to cope.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Central, Perfect for students.”
Reviews.Author: Nicothecalifornian
Reviews.Content: We went there with a group of friends. It was very good, quite central, there's a bus stop right in front of it, a couple of stops away from a plaza full of bars, shops, coffee shops, ... The guys at the reception were very nice and helpful. We were surprised as how the rooms were very clean and big, nice beds and nice decoration as we only paid +- 30 euros per night. The only negative point would be the breakfast (included), because it's only from 8 to 10, and if you arrive at 9h45, there's nothing left, and also there's not a lot of seats, so you sometimes have to wait for people to finish their breakfast and leave; But overall very nice hotel, central not too expensive, perfect if you're in your 20's, don't care about luxury and go there with friends to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly bad hotel...smelly and costly”
Reviews.Author: Paulb12345
Reviews.Content: A terrible smell pervades through the hotel. The rooms are poorly cleaned and are tired looking. I can't believe that they charge â‚¬120 for a room..it is not worth â‚¬20 a night. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “very handy for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: melafellabulldogs
Reviews.Content: we stayed for one night moving on to another hotel as visiting Amsterdam on a judging trip. this hotel is very central, close to the museums and Concert Hall, its a short tram ride to central station and Dam Square and the tourist attractions, ie, The red light district, the hotel is basic, clean but small hotel rooms,

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Louise237
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4 girls for the weekend. The price was really cheap so I wasn't expecting much in fact I was dreading what I was going to find. I was pleasantly suprised, the room was a little on the small side but the main thing was that it was clean. Had a weird small but once we aired the room it was fine. Bathroom was sufficient and clean also had a weird smell. Our friensds room was a lot bigger but faced the front of the building and they said they were a little disturbed from traffic noise and church bells. The room was always warm which was nice when you just got in. Staff were helpful whenever we needed something. Breakfast was included in our room room price and was decent with lots to choose from. Location is ok you are right in the Museumplein but to get to the shops, bars, coffeeshops and food places it was a bit of trek. I would say about 15- 20 mins walk to Leidsplein where its more lively. I would stay here again for the hotel and its price but not for its location.

Reviews.Title: “basic, good position”
Reviews.Author: elybrera
Reviews.Content: The Concert Hotel seems to be a rather old, all of wood, typical, but they should remove the carpet from the stairs from the reception and from the rooms, as soon as you enter you immediately smell the typical unpleasant odor because of too many years of carpeting. Apart from this disadvantage, if you are not too sophisticated, is a great hotel especially for the price / location, the center can easily be reached on foot otherwise just opposite the hotel you can find tram stop (number16). Also very comfortable bus 197 from the airport. Comfortable beds and clean, TV, wi-fi, coffee to tea and coffee, shower gel shampoo etc. ... and hairdryer. when I will return to Amsterdam I will book again this hotel, unless I find an other hotel for the same price, but with the same convenient location with breakfast included. At The Concert Hotel breakfast is not included and they ask for 10 euro per person. It seems too expensive as the city offers several bakeries and bars where you can enjoy delicious breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small room”
Reviews.Author: Ms_petunia
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, with no place to put on the lugagge. Bathroom was very local but deff not to hotel standars. heat was always on and you could not turn it off at a room level. Well situated however.

Reviews.Title: “The picture is not representative of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilarosa1964
Reviews.Content: The bed was very comfortable but the room was so small. There was no place to put the luggage in the room. The room was clean and it is a good location and safe. Too expensive for what I got.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: SimonPSurrey
Reviews.Content: Had a business trip to the RAI for the broadcast expo so hotels full in area, booked this last minute, expensive room â‚¬200 one night far too expensive, room very small and pong from bathroom. Bed very comfortable, no air-conditioning, breakfast was ok, reception friendly but in all it was so so small!

Reviews.Title: “if you are desperate for an expensive bed; do not expect to have a room”
Reviews.Author: MILANE63
Reviews.Content: I never had such a low m2/euro ratio ; 200â‚¬ for one night in a room were I could hardly stand without being in bed, No table to work, no chair or armchair to seat (as the only classroom chair I sued as a bed table) no place to put my suitcase; in front of the entry door even my student room was larger

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and Safe Location”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book a room at this hotel, given the other reviews, but I had to be in Amsterdam on Queen's Day (not by choice, though), and did not have too many options, as most hotels were totally booked. With my expectations being set really low, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel has started operations again after 5 years of being closed because of some property dispute. They have just completed the renovations and resumed operations. This means that some things are really new. For instance, the bed, which was very comfortable, appeared to be really brand new, so were the linens. The location of the hotel is spectacular, in a safe and upscale residential area, and within a stone's throw of Museumplein and Concertgebouw. The reception is now in the building itself, and the tall blond gentleman who greeted me was very nice and helpful. Their breakfast room is lovely, and they serve a fantastic breakfast, with smoked salmon, and champaign. You can make your own mimosas. I am not sure if champaign is available on weekdays too, but it was certainly there on the weekend. My room was rather small, and felt even smaller perhaps because the bed was for two people, but the bed was very comfortable. I would have rearranged the furniture to make it more pleasing to the eye, and the bathroom was very small too. This comes from someone who travels in Europe often, and is used to the smaller scale of European hotels rooms, in general.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a sham and very rude reception”
Reviews.Author: sweethart241
Reviews.Content: hotel was supposed to be re-furbished 8th april so my husband and I booked with another couple for his birthday, upon arrival workmen were everywhere finishing hotel, rooms had no running water so no toilet facilities and there was nowhere to hand clothes not a wardrobe, pole or even a hook for them, no kettle or tea and coffee in room and workmen thought it was okay to just walk into your room without knocking or waiting for you to let them in, paint tins all over the staircases, no lighting in staircases, I went to reception to ask to be moved rooms and the guy on reception was a complete nutter, he was laughing at me saying all british people moan and that if i wasnt happy to leave (after already paying), he was very aggressive and very rude, had to change hotels in the end after threathening him with the police if he didnt change his ways and give us a full refund, he had both myself and my friend in tears and it was supposed to be the first day of our holidays, the museum square hotel next door managed to find us a room in the end and they were excellent far superior to the concert hotel, please don not stay here if you have a choice!!

HotelInfo.Name: AMS Hotel Concert Inn
HotelInfo.Address: De Lairessestraat 11, Amsterdam 1071 NR, The Netherlands
